title: FIND (Function)
text:
FUNCTION FIND : INT
Searches for the position of a partial string within a string.
FIND(STR1,
STR2)
means: Find the position of the first character where
STR2
appears
in
STR1
for the first time. If STR2 is not found in STR1, then OUT:=0.
(* Example declaration *)
arINT1
:
INT
;
(* Example in ST , result is '4' *)
arINT1
:=
FIND
(
'abcdef'
,
'de'
);

rows.Name: FIND
rows.Comment: Character position of the first occurance ofSTR2inSTR1. If no occurance is found, result is 0

rows: String whose position is searched inSTR1
